snippet: Three-year medical school is gaining ground as educators acknowledge: Becoming a doctor just takes too long.
abstract: Idea of three-year medical school is taking hold in some of America's leading institutions; proponents argue that a year could be trimmed from traditional four-year curriculum, which is based on recommendations from a 1910 study, without sacrificing education quality; also say doing so would reduce student debt.
lead_paragraph: Three-year medical school is gaining ground as educators acknowledge: Becoming a doctor just takes too long.
